title: Sources
text: The following sources were used in this project…

title: Sources
text:
Dataset 1 (dementia_dataset.csv)
The data used in some sections of this project was downloaded from Kaggle. This dataset, “Dementia Prediction Dataset” contains data from 150 patients ages 60 through 96.

https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/shashwatwork/dementia-prediction-dataset

title: Sources
text:
Dataset 2 (dementia_patients_health_data.csv)
The other data used in this project was also downloaded from Kaggle. This dataset, “Dementia Patient Health, Prescriptions ML Dataset” contains data from 1,000 patients ages 60 through 90.

https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/kaggler2412/dementia-patient-health-and-prescriptions-dataset/data

title: Graphs
text:
Here is a deeper look into specific demographics…









Among a group of 150 individuals ranging in age from 60 to 96, more than a third were demented.









Of those with dementia in the group of 150 individuals, there was a high amount of people ages 70 through 80.









In the 150 individual group, the median social economic status was level 4.









In a group of 1,000 individuals, all people with dementia had cognitive test scores below 7.5









Education levels do not vary largely.

title: Dementia Demographics
text: The spread of dementia across different demographics appears to be associated with only certain groups. The data sets used were sourced from Kaggle which contained de-identified data of a selection of patients. The data sets were individually analyzed and graphed to show relationships between the prevalence of dementia among different groups. From this, it was found that people with the gene APOE e4 (the gene most associated with having Alzheimer’s) are much more common among people with dementia.

title: Dementia Demographics
text: The spread of dementia across different demographics appears to be associated with only certain groups. The data sets used were sourced from Kaggle which contained de-identified data of a selection of patients. The data sets were individually analyzed and graphed to show relationships between the prevalence of dementia among different groups. From this, it was found that people with the gene APOE e4 (the gene most associated with having Alzheimer’s) are much more common among people with dementia.

title: Dementia Demographics
text:
Dementia Demographic Spread









Interestingly, most other groups do not appear to have significant correlation between the populations of people with and without Dementia, except for the variable of having APOE e4. APOE e4 is a gene that is associated with a greatly increased risk for Alzheimer’s.

title: Dementia Demographics
text:
Overview of Dementia
Though commonly thought of as a disease, dementia is more of a group of symptoms that impair cognitive function. These symptoms may be caused by a variety of other diseases, such as Alzheimer’s, Huntington’s, Lewy body, or multiple of these combined. It is unfortunately associated with the misconception that it comes naturally with age.
Dementia is characterized by the main symptoms being:
  - Memory loss
  
  - Communication problems
  
  - Confusion or disorientation
  
  - Difficulty with certain tasks
  
  - Problems with movement
  
  
These symptoms can negatively impact a person’s life. It can make everyday tasks that were once easy seem difficult.
Now, with Dementia being considered a very common condition, it is more important than ever to understand the spread of this disease.
